Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can identify and draw different types of living things in a land habitat, such as a forest or garden, including a few distinct plants and animals.
The student can identify and draw basic types of living things in a water habitat, like a pond, showing animals like fish and frogs.
The student can draw patterns of diversity by including various types of plants and animals within a single habitat, although some species might not be distinctly drawn.
The student can compare different habitats by drawing and labeling some distinct living things found in each, like trees in a forest and flowers in a garden.
The student can use observations to draw and label some key features of each habitat that support different kinds of life, such as trees providing shade in a forest.
CANNOT: The student may have difficulties in accurately labeling all species included in their habitat drawings (e.g., labels might be missing or incorrect).

The student is likely unable to demonstrate a complete and sophisticated representation of all the unique features of each habitat, such as the specific adaptations of each plant or animal (student might only show general features).
The student may show a limited understanding of rare or less commonly known living things in certain habitats (e.g., omitting simpler or unfamiliar species that inhabit these areas).
Inconsistencies may occur in accurately showing the interaction between the living things and their environment (e.g., forgetting to show how some animals rely on certain plants for food).
